proposed_strategy.name: Validated Group by Character Count
proposed_strategy.description: The entire provided Adhyaya (including Prakāśikā) is small enough to fit into a single chunk, well below the safety character limit.

execution_plan.description: The entirety of the Third Adhyaya (Pratardana Vidyā) including the commentary (Prakāśikā) and final summary.

parsing_instructions.justification: The Adhyaya is fundamentally divided into numbered Mantras (verses), each followed by its respective commentary, making the Mantra (with commentary) the smallest logical unit for parsing.

start_pattern.description: A new Mantra unit starts with the completion of the verse text, marked by the double danda surrounding the verse number.

end_pattern.description: The unit ends immediately before the start of the next Mantra's numbering pattern, or at the explicit Adhyaya colophon/conclusion.
examples: (Implicitly ends before the next verse number)

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: Treat all text before the first instance of '॥ १॥' (including the Canonical Title, Commentary details, Adhyaya title, and bracketed thematic summary) as prefatory material for the Third Adhyaya.
